skill.name: internal-comms
skill.description: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my company likes to use. Claude should use this skill whenever asked to write some sort of internal communications (status reports, leadership updates, 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQs, incident reports, project updates, etc.).
skill.summary: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my ...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown guideline files. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external command execution. The skill provides writing instructions and formatting templates for internal communications.

content.value_statement: Writing clear internal communications takes time and consistency. This skill provides ready-made formats and guidelines for 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQs, and general announcements so you can communicate effectively across your organization.
actual_capabilities: Write Progress, Plans, Problems (3P) team updates
Create company-wide newsletters with structured sections
Answer frequently asked questions from employees
Draft general internal communications with proper tone and format
Gather information from Slack, email, calendar, and documents
Follow consistent formatting across all communication types
limitations: Requires user to provide team name and time period
Needs access to company tools (Slack, email, calendar) for full functionality
Does not create new information - synthesizes existing updates

use_cases.title: Weekly Team Updates
use_cases.description: Create concise 3P updates for executives and leadership covering what the team accomplished, plans for next week, and current blockers.

use_cases.title: Company Newsletters
use_cases.description: Summarize company-wide news across departments into structured newsletters for Slack and email distribution.

use_cases.title: Employee FAQs
use_cases.description: Identify common employee questions and provide clear answers based on official company communications.

prompt_templates.title: Basic 3P Update
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a 3P update for the Engineering team covering the past week. Include progress made, plans for next week, and any blockers.

prompt_templates.title: Company Newsletter
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a company newsletter covering announcements, leadership updates, and progress on key priorities from the past month.

prompt_templates.title: FAQ Response
prompt_templates.prompt: Write an FAQ response about our remote work policy. What questions do employees commonly ask and what are the official answers?

prompt_templates.title: General Communication
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft an internal announcement about a new benefits program. Target all employees, keep it clear and concise with links to documentation.

best_practices: Include metrics and data in updates to make them more actionable for leadership
Use consistent formatting and structure across all communication types
Gather information from multiple sources (Slack, email, documents) before drafting
anti_patterns: Writing overly long updates that exceed 30-60 seconds to read
Including team-specific details in company-wide newsletters
Duplicating information already communicated in other channels

faq.question: What is a 3P update?
faq.answer: 3P stands for Progress, Plans, Problems. It is a concise weekly update format for teams to share accomplishments, upcoming priorities, and blockers with leadership.

faq.question: What tools does this skill access?
faq.answer: The skill guides Claude to use available tools like Slack, email, calendar, and document stores to gather information for communications.

faq.question: Can I customize the formatting templates?
faq.answer: Yes, you can modify the example files in the examples/ directory to match your company's preferred communication formats and styles.

faq.question: Is my company data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, this is a prompt-based skill with no code execution. All data handling is done through Claude's built-in tools with your existing security controls.

faq.question: What communication formats are supported?
faq.answer: Supported formats include 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQ responses, general announcements, status reports, leadership updates, and incident reports.

faq.question: How does this differ from general writing skills?
faq.answer: This skill is specifically designed for enterprise internal communications with structured formats, audience targeting, and tool integration for company data.
